question.text: Which of these pairs are incorrectly clubbed together?

options.text: Cells in adult animals which do not divide - Heart cells
Disc shaped structures at the surface of centromere -  Kinetochores
Initiation of assembly of mitotic spindle - Mitotic metaphase

solution.text: Heart cells on differentiation lose the ability to divide in adulthood. Mitosis is the cell division process where the cell divides to form two identical daughter cells to its parent cell. Kinetochores are present over the centromeres that held the sister chromatids together. Kinetochores are disc shaped. The mitotic spindle apparatus forms during the prophase of mitosis and in metaphase the chromosomes move towards the equator.
